mil3.3.6:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.3.6:0.3_0: for one who desires the good.
mil3.3.6:1.3_0: “But great king, where’s the knowledge master?”
mil3.3.6:1.4_0: “Sir, if anyone who sees a sight with their eyes were ears and hears a sound with the eye, hears sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts. When I see what’s best, I would sit down.
mil3.3.6:1.5_0: In the same way, this pot is just a weapon who wants to see a soul gate.”
mil3.3.6:2.1_0: A senior monk who brought the following:
mil3.3.6:2.2_0: “Great king, all of these things, I shall listen to you. Even if you see a sight with your nose, tongue, body, and mind. Even if you see any sight, you’ll be able to travel by see me, whether or not you’d see him or fancy him.
mil3.3.6:2.3_0: Since they stream with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
mil3.3.6:2.4_0: Smelled with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.
mil3.3.6:2.5_0: Tasting a flavor with the eye, tastes a flavor, taste, and taste it, they taste it.
mil3.3.6:2.6_0: You can experience touches with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
mil3.3.6:2.7_0: Wouldn’t you have the eye forehears with the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind. Would you have the teachings known by the nose?”
mil3.3.6:3.1_1: When it has been brought into the nose ...
mil3.3.6:3.1_3: When they have been gathered in the body of Ugga with a large, of sounds, smells, tastes, and touches?”
mil3.3.6:4.1_0: “Great king, didn’t you stay behind the first day after the full moon of the rainy season, the first lucidity of the rainy season, where you know that it was given to you.
mil3.3.6:4.3_0: “But great king, suppose this gift was given in front of me, but you know that it was given to me: ‘Great king, standing in front of me, Videhanging down in front of me’?”
mil3.3.6:4.5_0: “In the same way, when the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
mil3.3.6:4.7_0: if that were given up, they would know whether the soil had entered, the gambler, the color of oil, the honey, or the syrup.
mil3.3.6:5.1_0: “Great king, didn’t you recall the first dragging back from the west, the north, or the south, and the sacrificial digested food. Wouldn’t they know that person has thick rice porridge cooked, and honey balls it thoroughly?”
mil3.3.6:5.4_0: Because that mouth hasn’t entered his mouth.”
mil3.3.6:6.1_0: “Great king, in the first month, the second or the middle of the day.”
mil3.3.6:6.2_0: I’m not able to talk with you,
mil3.3.6:7.1_0: He then paid attention on the king Makhādeva Mango Grove:
mil3.3.6:7.2_0: “Great king, take a eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact. And they focus on one, one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand.
mil3.3.6:7.3_0: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts. The intention that gives rise to contact. Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is felt. When you feel attention, you don’t focus on the mind, and no longer turn for the faculty.”
mil3.3.6:9.1_0: The sixth section for recitation is finished.
